title: IFrame credentialless
summary: IFrame credentialless provides a mechanism for developers to load third-party resources in <iframe>s using a new, ephemeral context. It doesn't have access to its regular origin's network, cookies, and storage data. It uses a new context local to the top-level document lifetime. In return, the Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy (COEP) embedding rules can be lifted, so documents with COEP set can embed third-party documents that do not.
pageTitle: IFrame credentialless - Security on the web | MDN
